commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: I46fd53fe70c4e63e5b06043bd650a2d6dc7e9ff1

Remove disable-workflow-tasks.yaml env

Once workflow_tasks are removed from the ceph templates, we no longer
need to include the environment to explicitly disable them.

commit_message:
Use cloudkitty_collector also for section config

Each collector needs its own config section, so use cloudkitty_collector
to create these sections.

Change-Id: I6bc4c395693265ea08067bb293a99a72b48fe9a6
Closes-Bug: 1769629

commit_message:
Loosen up the sqlalchemy requirements

The upstream requierements do not fit openstack-ansible venvs.
So explicitly loosen up until fixed upstream.

commit_message:
conf: Resolve TODOs in 'database'

These are self-explanatory, with some exceptions:

- IntOpt does not take a 'choices' parameter
- 'connection' cannot have a 'required' parameter as not all nodes
  need it and it would break upgrades
- Some of the defaults suggested weren't actually defaults in oslo.db

Change-Id: Id3bb4224a30f2abe26c89af6bc5546127c4db739

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-20 11:06:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'objects: remove pagesize from __init__ of InstanceNUMATopology

Removes the initialization of pagesize to None when creating new
instances of InstanceNUMATopology. This necessitates checking for the
presence of the field before using it.

As part of this change, a bug in tests for overcommitting of NUMA cells
was uncovered. The tests are reworked to resolve this and documentation
added in case people find the feature as confusing as I did initially.

Change-Id: I11392bb5bcb4427faae3cb8bba2d615271203e81
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2018-03-12 15:19:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py', 'nova/objects/instance_numa_topology.py'], 'message': 'objects: remove pagesize from __init__ of InstanceNUMATopology

Removes the initialization of pagesize to None when creating new
instances of InstanceNUMATopology. This necessitates checking for the
presence of the field before using it. The current pattern allowed us to
avoid this check, at the expense of not being able to inspect objects
easily and consistently generate a list of fields.

As part of this change, a bug in tests for overcommitting of NUMA cells
was uncovered. The tests are reworked to resolve this and documentation
added in case people find the feature as confusing as I did initially.

Change-Id: I11392bb5bcb4427faae3cb8bba2d615271203e81
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
objects: remove pagesize from __init__ of InstanceNUMATopology

Removes the initialization of pagesize to None when creating new
instances of InstanceNUMATopology. This necessitates checking for the
presence of the field before using it. The current pattern allowed us to
avoid this check, at the expense of not being able to inspect objects
easily and consistently generate a list of fields.

As part of this change, a bug in tests for overcommitting of NUMA cells
was uncovered. The tests are reworked to resolve this and documentation
added in case people find the feature as confusing as I did initially.

Change-Id: I11392bb5bcb4427faae3cb8bba2d615271203e81
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
objects: remove related pinning from __init__ of InstanceNUMATopology

Removes the initialization of 'cpu_pinning', 'cpu_policy' and
'cpu_thread_policy' when creating object InstanceNUMATopology. The
current pattern allowed us to avoid some checks but meant we could
easily inspect objects and consistently generate a list of fields. This
also allows us to fix two bugs:

- Fix backwards compatibility for InstanceNUMACell

  Pre-1.3 versions of InstanceNUMACell didn't have a 'cpu_policy' field.
  However, after this, the 'cpu_pinning_requested' function was changed
  to rely on this variable. This is resolved through the reinstatement
  of the pre-1.3 check for pre-1.3 objects versions.

- Fix a faulty unit test

  We should check 'nova_object.data', not the primitive itself.

Change-Id: Iac4c6895c7059fa095906304a7e74c0c89057cd2
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Resolves-bug: #1636338

commit_message:
objects: remove cpuset_reserved from __init__ of InstanceNUMATopology

This commit removes the initialization of cpuset_reserved to None when
creating object InstanceNUMATopology. The current pattern allowed us to
avoid some checks but meant we could inspect objects easily and
consistently generate a list of fields.

Change-Id: I31937b288a9549341426d2e619aae39b3e8550c7

commit_message:
Improve Bootstrap resilience

Sync relevant changes from charms.ceph

Disable `ceph-create-keys` in init system and explicitly
run it in the charms ceph-mon bootstrap process.

Change-Id: I03cd596e6e336b75d7d108ed0acde15d9940913f
Depends-On: I3d3c7298076730c423ca5cc059316619f415b885
Closes-Bug: #1719436

It appears to be a typo introduced with
I18bbf693bca2f6e49d822ae2940d2170a2b90ce9; make sure we're walking the
self.builders list; not the string self.builder.

Change-Id: Ic038029c361b3ede48f2b495c74430d3ad1eab82
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix builddoc with sphinx <= 1.6

I went to build infra-specs which specifies sphinx==1.5.6 and hit

 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "setup.py", line 29, in <module>
     pbr=True)
   ...
  File ".../pbr/builddoc.py", line 235, in run
    self._sphinx_run()
  File ".../pbr/builddoc.py", line 162, in _sphinx_run
    freshenv=self.fresh_env, warningiserror=self.warning_is_error)
  File ".../sphinx/application.py", line 244, in __init__
    self._init_builder(self.buildername)
  File "...//sphinx/application.py", line 311, in _init_builder
    raise SphinxError('Builder name %s not registered' % buildername)
 sphinx.errors.SphinxError: Builder name h not registered

It appears to be a typo introduced with
I18bbf693bca2f6e49d822ae2940d2170a2b90ce9; make sure we're walking the
self.builders list; not the string self.builder.

Change-Id: Ic038029c361b3ede48f2b495c74430d3ad1eab82

commit_message:
Add ssh-user to get_tripleo_ansible_inventory

We were missing --ssh-user when calling
get_tripleo_ansible_inventory assigning
overcloud as the ssh_user by default.

This is failing after adding the --stack option
as he had only one before

Change-Id: I447a050ce67d626e7050a22c9821f883ebeda2ee
Closes-Bug: 1767379
Closes-Bug: 1769974

subject: Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 07:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

commit_message:
Fix the gate jobs

This patch including two backport commits.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail

(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb

commit_message:
Take control of when `ceph-create-keys` is run

For Ceph versions prior to Luminous the `ceph-create-keys`
is run by the init system in conjunction with starting the
ceph-mon service.

At some point during the Hammer lifetime a hard coded timeout
of 600 seconds was added:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/8bab74537f5891f2b97f0fb6722e2e00416b723a

In many circumstances this is not enough.  With this commit
we take control of running this command.

__NOTE__ it is important that charms deploying the ceph-mon
disable running of `ceph-create-keys` from the init system.

From Luminous and onwards we can use the newly added --timeout
flag.  For previous versions we rely on retry_on_exception
decorator.

Change-Id: I3d3c7298076730c423ca5cc059316619f415b885
Related-Bug: #1719436

different backend after snapshot got deleted.

subject: Fix sphinx-docs job
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 12:00:04.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh'], 'message': 'Fix sphinx-docs job

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555788

Change-Id: I69663be876def03f47594c838591cfdb10d00871
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

This patch is necessary until the tox_install.sh removal [1] is merged in.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555788

commit_message:
Generate and mount wrappers for neutron agent processes

The neutron agents use things like dnsmasq and keepalived as part of
their implementation. Running these "subprocesses" in separate
containers prevent dataplane breakages/unnecessary failover on agent
container restart. This patch triggers the creation and mounting of
wrappers for launching these processes in containers.

Related-Bug: #1749209

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 03:20:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Avoid running kolla source jobs for unnecessary  files

While fixing test-requirement.txt, I found that
check pipeline can be more optimized in term of selecting
the jobs to run based on file change.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567083/
kolla main jobs are not needed to be run on check
pipeline for test-requirements.txt, test/* etc.

This commit skip those jobs when only above files
are changed in patch. This is will save time as well
as infra resource also.

Change-Id: I0c1328237d2109b1d1d5dcb40f331fff1ab10257

commit_message:
Avoid running kolla source jobs for unnecessary  files

While fixing test-requirement.txt, I found that
check pipeline can be more optimized in term of selecting
the jobs to run based on file change.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567083/
kolla main jobs are not needed to be run on check
pipeline for test-requirements.txt, releasenotes/* etc.

This commit skip those jobs when only above files
are changed in patch. This is will save time as well
as infra resource also.

Change-Id: I0c1328237d2109b1d1d5dcb40f331fff1ab10257

commit_message:
Updated tests on bug, when get list returns deleted items

In I4d2f44fa149aee564c62a69822c6ad79de5bba8a we introduced new
_get_model_list method that introduces unify way for retrieving models
from db. This commit adds tests that do checks on bug 1761956, when
selecting with filter() method could return deleted entites.

Change-Id: I12df4af70bcc25654a0fb276ea7145d772d891e2
Related-Bug: 1761956

subject: Fix the gate with backport packages
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 08:30:18.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'deploy-guide/source/multinode.rst', 'doc/source/user/quickstart.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/CONTRIBUTING.rst', 'deploy-guide/source/quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Fix the gate with backport packages

This patch is including two patches to fix the gate.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Change-Id: I05e49bbcef564ad4f3d80f0649ccf191d9f8b59d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the gate with backport packages

This patch is including two patches to fix the gate.

Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html
(cherry picked from commit 197a264a3b772f9d6c9c9775bf00357e2a7a9a10)

Fix deploy-guide links

Deploy guides includes quickstart guide.
Includes respect relative paths, but when
quickstart includes vagrant doc, deploy-guide
tries to locate the doc in its doctree (deploy-guide/source).

This causes error 404 and deploy-guide post-gates to fail
(cherry picked from commit ccd542f7ea26d792ca8a07539f66fac6dfddbfb9)

Change-Id: I05e49bbcef564ad4f3d80f0649ccf191d9f8b59d

commit_message:
Don't install criu for arm64/s390x prior to artful

The criu package doesn't exist for arm64/s390x prior to artful,
causing an install hook failure. Let's not attempt to install
it when that is the case.

Change-Id: If0cc517d9e607604e427aab385fabd8a9a193fdf
Closes-Bug: #1748235

subject: Added _get_model_list base method for all get_*_list methods
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-07 09:41:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "audittemplate list returns deleted Audit Templates

When we call audittemplate list without filters, it returns all Audit
Templates that are not deleted as expected. If we add any filter to
query and context.show_deleted is None (we request only current AT),
query.filter_by adds filter to joined table (for example, goals, results
 in query like JOIN goals ... WHERE ... goals.deleted_at IS NULL) not to
 model's table (AuditTemplate in our case).

We change call for filter_by to filter, explicitly point to model that
we want to filter.

Change-Id: I4d2f44fa149aee564c62a69822c6ad79de5bba8a
Closes-bug: 1761956
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-04-10 11:12:26.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Added _get_model_list base method for all get_*_list methods

When we call audittemplate list without filters, it returns all Audit
Templates that are not deleted, as expected. If we add any filter to
query and context.show_deleted is None (we request only current AT),
query.filter_by adds filter to joined table (for example, goals, results
 in a query like JOIN goals ... WHERE ... goals.deleted_at IS NULL) not
to model's table (AuditTemplate in our case).

We change call for filter_by to filter, explicitly point to model that
we want to filter.

Also, we moved query generating code to new method _get_model_list(). As
a result we applied same fix to all of the other models.

Change-Id: I4d2f44fa149aee564c62a69822c6ad79de5bba8a
Closes-bug: 1761956
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Added _get_model_list base method for all get_*_list methods

When we call audittemplate list without filters, it returns all Audit
Templates that are not deleted, as expected. If we add any filter to
query and context.show_deleted is None (we request only current AT),
query.filter_by adds filter to joined table (for example, goals, results
 in a query like JOIN goals ... WHERE ... goals.deleted_at IS NULL) not
to model's table (AuditTemplate in our case).

We change call for filter_by to filter, explicitly point to model that
we want to filter.

Also, we moved query generating code to new method _get_model_list(). As
a result we applied same fix to all of the other models.

Change-Id: I4d2f44fa149aee564c62a69822c6ad79de5bba8a
Closes-bug: 1761956

With the HA NG work having landed, the impact of pacemaker
is reduced and only very few core services are being managed
by pacemaker. Since the HA deployments work just fine
with a single node, it makes little sense to use the non-ha
deployment as default any longer (Also because downstream
we do the default to the HA deployment by default and this
keeps confusing users)

The change in OOOQ-extras try to
change the way the pacemaker env files are used.

commit_message:
Enable the HA deployment by default

With the HA NG work having landed, the impact of pacemaker
is reduced and only very few core services are being managed
by pacemaker. Since the HA deployments work just fine
with a single node, it makes little sense to use the non-ha
deployment as default any longer (Also because downstream
we do the default to the HA deployment by default and this
keeps confusing users)

The change in OOOQ-extras try to
change the way the pacemaker env files are used.

Depends-On: I3a486d22b30ffdb6053b3d917dea373c1361df81
Change-Id: Ibfc86bc6e7f589a20fc82ad161d69e5c8c7a8cb8

commit_message:
IBM XIV: enable FC zoning to all the ports

Define FC host just considers connected FC target ports, which should
enable host to connect to all the storage FC ports for zoning.

Change-Id: Ibb20917c8ed80cb1413de1d61104d495605ec3df
Closes-Bug:#1759994

commit_message:
Add NetworkErrorException for socket.error

Sometimes rest_client can meet connection refused socket error
if the server is not listening on socket port yet. This patch
maps this error to NetworkErrorException so up layer caller can
handle it properly.

Change-Id: I946026221ded380b55d566ed9b1346e58386d167

commit_message:
Add volumes_links attribute in list_volumes schema

When GETting os-volumes, the returned list of volumes respects the
osapi_max_limit configuration parameter but does not provide a link to
the next element in the list. But volumes_links attribute not allowd in
volume list. We need to add volumes_links attribute in tempest.

Implements: blueprint resource-links-attribute-add
Change-Id: I8721b9648e22273232b108c67250749eda6c506a
Closes-Bug: 1504641

subject: Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 01:01:56.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

Change-Id: I05790c5f946a4127fe6c8d9867cc618cb83d67fb
